name: Ashton Jeanty

weaknesses: Ball security issues (9 fumbles in 2 seasons)

strengths: Elite arm talent with velocity and accuracy
weaknesses: Not a dual-threat, limiting rushing points

name: Travis Hunter
strengths: Elite ball skills and football IQ
Fluid athlete with speed and quickness

name: Omarion Hampton
weaknesses: Lacks elite burst or top speed
Upright running style vulnerable to tackles

strengths: Strong arm with velocity and touch
Mobile in pocket, adds rushing value
weaknesses: More game manager than star creator

name: TreVeyon Henderson
strengths: Agile with vision for chunk plays

name: Mason Graham

name: James Pearce Jr.
strengths: Long arms for PDs and forced fumbles

strengths: Strong inside runner between the tackles

name: Cam Skattebo

name: Jihaad Campbell
weaknesses: Needs to add strength vs run

name: Tyler Shough

name: Dillon Gabriel

name: Shedeur Sanders

Arm strength not elite on outside throws

name: Kyle McCord
weaknesses: Limited arm talent, lacks deep zip

name: Riley Leonard
strengths: High character leader, adapts to systems
weaknesses: Limited elite production due to injuries

name: Will Howard
strengths: Big, strong frame with arm strength
Experienced in big games, adds rushing power

name: Quinn Ewers
strengths: Smooth thrower with touch and anticipation
Clutch in big spots, championship experience
weaknesses: Arm strength good but not elite

name: Jaylin Smith
strengths: Solid long speed and eye discipline
weaknesses: Lacks elite size for physical matchups

name: Woody Marks
strengths: Versatile receiving back with good hands
weaknesses: Lacks elite speed or power for lead role

name: Jonah Monheim
weaknesses: Tweener size, lacks ideal tackle length
Needs to add strength for NFL interior

name: Jacobe Covington
strengths: Long-limbed boundary CB with press skills
Good ball skills, disrupts at catch point

name: Greedy Vance Jr.
strengths: Quick in nickel role, good slot coverage

name: John Humphrey
strengths: Good ball skills, plays the football
weaknesses: Lacks elite speed for deep coverage
Needs to add strength for press

name: Jamil Muhammad
weaknesses: Needs to add bulk for NFL

name: Eddie Czaplicki
strengths: Strong leg for hang time and distance

name: Akili Arnold
strengths: Diverse skill set, versatile in secondary
Strong in coverage, high PFF grade

name: R.J. Harvey
strengths: Burst through the hole with acceleration

name: Bhayshul Tuten
strengths: Natural pass-catching traits out of backfield

name: Trevor Etienne
strengths: Elusive with quick cuts and vision
Dynamic in space as receiver and runner

name: Jarquez Hunter
strengths: Powerful build with burst through holes

name: Jordan James
strengths: Potential to develop into three-down role

name: Emeka Egbuka
strengths: Fits as slot weapon with WR1 upside
weaknesses: Crowded Bucs WR room limits immediate volume

name: Matthew Golden
strengths: Opportunity in Packers young WR room

name: Jayden Higgins
strengths: Clear path to targets with Dell sidelined
weaknesses: Limited long speed vs elite CBs

name: Elic Ayomanor
strengths: Pairs with Cam Ward for chemistry

name: Isaiah Bond
strengths: Quick in/out of breaks, YAC potential
weaknesses: Limited route tree, needs intermediate game
Target share capped in run-heavy scheme

name: Evan Stewart
strengths: Upside as slot WR with Richardson

name: Jack Bech
strengths: Physical slot receiver with strong hands
Tough after catch, forces missed tackles
weaknesses: Lacks elite speed, limited deep threat
Former TE transition, refining WR nuances

name: Tory Horton
strengths: Big, physical receiver with play strength
Chance to replace MVS as WR3
weaknesses: Needs to improve vs press coverage

name: Jalen Royals
weaknesses: Limited route tree, raw outside shots
Needs to add strength for NFL

name: Isaac TeSlaa
strengths: Lions traded up, early role signaled
weaknesses: Needs to improve release vs press
Inconsistent YAC due to build-up speed

name: Jaylin Lane
strengths: Path to WR3 role behind McLaurin/Samuel
weaknesses: Needs to prove consistency at NFL level

name: Nick Nash
strengths: Depth role with upside if injuries hit
weaknesses: Needs to refine routes for NFL separation

name: Kyle Williams
strengths: Quick release off line, creates separation
weaknesses: Limited route tree, needs intermediate polish

name: Xavier Restrepo
strengths: Quick slot receiver with reliable hands
Tough after catch, fights for extra yards
Fits Giants offense as WR3/4 with Nabers
weaknesses: Lacks elite speed or size, limited ceiling
Target share capped in crowded WR room

name: Pat Bryant
strengths: Strong hands in traffic, red-zone potential
Developmental role behind Sutton with upside
weaknesses: Limited YAC due to lack of burst

name: Dane Key
strengths: Tall, rangy receiver with contested-catch ability
Reliable hands, adjusts to off-target throws
Depth role with potential if injuries hit
weaknesses: Inconsistent college production due to QB play

name: Jalon Walker
strengths: Athletic and versatile hybrid defender; excels as edge rusher or spy
High draft capital suggests extended opportunities in IDP
Potential to rush the passer and make plays in space
weaknesses: Needs development at off-ball linebacker position
Raw in coverage; may struggle initially in pass defense
Versatility could limit snaps if not focused on one role

name: Jihaad Campbell
strengths: Big, long, fast with burst; physical and rangy in coverage
Pass rush ability; can blitz and play edge in packages
Productive off-ball LB in college; adapts well to Vic Fangio's scheme
weaknesses: May be pigeonholed; needs to define primary role
Injury timeline for teammates could affect snaps

name: Carson Schwesinger
strengths: Three-down skill set; can hold down the middle of the defense
Tackle monster with high draft capital; bright dynasty outlook
Opportunity due to veteran uncertainties and health issues
weaknesses: Limited athletic upside compared to peers
Needs to prove consistency at NFL level
Run defense focus may limit pass-rush stats

name: Demetrius Knight Jr.
strengths: NFL-ready build and physicality; strong coverage grades
Sound tackler with second-round capital; starts alongside Logan Wilson
weaknesses: May need time to adjust to pro speed
Teammate trade requests could affect role

name: Nick Martin
strengths: Athletic with burst and speed; 140 tackles, 16 TFLs, 8 sacks in 2023
Productive despite smaller size; high IDP tackle potential
Versatile in run and pass defense

name: Jack Kiser
strengths: Sound tackler with special teams value; high PFF grades (91.9 overall)
Low miss tackle rate (4.8%); strong in run defense and coverage
weaknesses: Size may hinder vs. bigger TEs
Needs more blitz opportunities for sacks

name: Danny Stutsman
strengths: Tackle guy with nose for the ball; big, strong, and fast
Makes plays behind the line; early down thumper role
Potential for immediate snaps in Saints' LB group
weaknesses: Needs to improve in pass defense

name: Cody Simon
strengths: Sound tackler as traditional off-ball LB; better run defender
Fourth-round capital with opportunity in Cardinals' defense

name: Barrett Carter
strengths: Athletic with speed; can cover TEs/RBs
weaknesses: Needs to add strength for run defense

name: Teddye Buchanan
strengths: Athletic and physical sound tackler; effective blitzer
High career coverage grade (98th percentile); low miss tackle rate
weaknesses: Transfer from UC Davis; adjustment to NFL speed

name: Colston Loveland
strengths: Mismatch TE with size and routes; red-zone threat for RETD points
Reliable hands and after-catch; PPR-friendly with YAC
Inline blocker; adds value in run-heavy schemes
weaknesses: Not elite speed; limited vertical stretch
Blocking technique raw; needs strength gains
Route tree limited; more slot than diverse

name: Tyler Warren
strengths: Massive frame with athleticism; dominates contested catches
Versatile blocker/receiver; three-down potential in PPR
High football IQ; adjusts to throws with body control
weaknesses: Limited speed; not a deep threat
Needs to refine route-running for separation

name: Mason Taylor
strengths: Reliable target; fits as security blanket for Aaron Rodgers
Upside in red zone with size and hands
weaknesses: Low yards per route run (63rd max); inefficient receiver
Limited YAC (5.4 avg); not explosive after catch
Only 14 missed tackles forced; lacks power

name: Elijah Arroyo
strengths: Athletic mismatch weapon; pushes for snaps over Noah Fant
High yards per route run (23rd); efficient target
Strong YAC per reception (2nd); elusive after catch
weaknesses: Blocking ability questionable; may limit snaps
Competition with Fant delays role until 2026
Dependent on Kupp's decline for targets

name: Terrance Ferguson
strengths: Top yards per route run (14th), YAC/rec (3rd); playmaker
Heir to Higbee; potential starter by 2026
weaknesses: Limited rookie snaps; gets feet wet in 2025
Needs to prove blocking for three-down role

name: Harold Fannin Jr.
strengths: Athletic pass-catcher; high yards after catch potential
Versatile alignment; flexes to slot for mismatches
Opportunity in Browns' offense with Njoku aging

name: Oronde Gadsden II
strengths: Big slot receiver; top yards per route run (5th 2024)
Path to targets with Dissly/Conklin ahead
weaknesses: Limited blocking; more WR than traditional TE

name: Gunnar Helm
strengths: Athletic mover with size; red-zone threat
Reliable hands; adjusts to throws well
Upside with Cam Ward in Titans' offense

name: Luke Lachey
strengths: Inline blocker with size; three-down capable
Strong hands in traffic; red-zone upside
Opportunity behind Schultz in Texans' offense
weaknesses: Limited speed; not a YAC creator

name: Mitchell Evans
strengths: Reliable target; fits Panthers' young offense
weaknesses: Needs to improve separation vs. LBs
